arts.ttl: What Martin O'Neill and Neil Lennon told Brendan Rodgers after Celtic draw vs Bayern
arts.sum: Brendan Rodgers says Neil Lennon and Martin O'Neill were waxing lyrical about Celtic's performance against Bayern Munich last night.

arts.ttl: Kompany on Kane's injury: "A bit of a shame"
arts.sum: Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany has discussed the injury that forced Harry Kane off at half-time against Celtic.

arts.ttl: Dramatically late goalscorer Alphonso Davies is just happy for Bayern Munich to reach the next stage of the UCL
arts.sum: “It’s the Champions League; we’re playing against a good Celtic team,” Davies readily said, via FCBayern.com . But the team eventually had to sober up and explain why the match against the Scottish champions, seen by many as an easy tie for the Bavarians, turned out to be so difficult.

arts.ttl: World media reacts as 'cold blooded' Celtic make Bayern suffer in coming of age Champions League epic
arts.sum: But for some 'clumsy' first half finishing, the Premiership champions would have ended Bayern's dreams of a Final on home turf

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich fans are all saying the same thing about Kasper Schmeichel after Celtic heartache
arts.sum: Bayern Munich knocked Celtic out of the Champions League on Tuesday night after a cruel stoppage-time goal from Alphonso Davies. Bayern Munich fans react to Kasper Schmeichel winning Man of the Match after Celtic defeat

arts.ttl: Alan Shearer makes his feelings clear on Celtic and Brendan Rodgers after Bayern Munich defeat
arts.sum: Despite playing a team that is being tipped to go a long way in this competition, they were probably lucky, not just to progress, but to get knocked out in normal time following Nicolas Kuhn deservedly opened the scoring in the second-half. “Big clubs and big teams, as we often say, when they don’t play well, they somehow have to find a way and Bayern Munich have done that.

arts.ttl: Celtic miss out on £9m Champions League fortune but bank record prize money as total earnings revealed
arts.sum: A bumper to the coffers will soften the blow of late elimination by Bayern Munich

arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Celtic; FC Barcelona defender headed to Tottenham Hotspur?; Barca out on Joshua Kimmich?; Manchester City plotting swoop for Bayer Leverkusen’s Florian Wirtz, Jeremie Frimpong?; and MORE!
arts.sum: A last minute goal from Alphonso Davies saved the nerves of many Bayern Munich fans as the 1-1 draw prevented the game from going into extra time where the Scottish side would have had a ton of momentum. Bayern Munich looked confident heading into its Champions League showdown with Celtic FC, but things did not go exactly how many thought they would.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany delighted with Bayern Munich’s 1-1 draw with Celtic, all things considered
arts.sum: They made incredibly hard work of it, but thanks to a late, stoppage time goal from substitute Alphonso Davies, Bayern Munich drew Celtic 1-1 at the Allianz Arena and went through 3-2 on aggregate in the Champions League playoff round. The two legs against Celtic might not have been anywhere near Bayern at their best, but they are still top of the Bundesliga and on to the next round of the Champions League after a tough stretch of fixtures.

arts.ttl: Nicolas Kühn almost sunk old team during Celtic’s 1-1 draw with Bayern Munich in the Champions League
arts.sum: Kühn almost scored in the first leg and also had another chance earlier in the match, but the 25-year-old finally struck gold in the 63rd minute to put Celtic up 1-0 — and put Bayern Munich firmly in danger of elimination of the Champions League. If there was any player with motivation to help Celtic FC take down Bayern Munich in the Champions League, it was former Bayern prospect Nicolas Kühn.
